epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Classified as normal-class and special-class concrete according to Australian Standard AS 1379.
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation exceeding 0.1% by weight.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Module D includes benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete

transport.average_transport_distance: 11.89 km from manufacturing gate to site

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: 100% of product assumed separately collected; delivery distances assumed due to lack of primary data

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete during use stage onward; not included in this EPD
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not reflected in EPD results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.database_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Processed waste concrete used as recycled aggregate replacing virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

product_classification.normal_class: For everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
product_classification.special_class: For major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, marine applications, high-strength, high-durability, architectural finishes

NSW_ACT.sources: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)

QLD.sources: Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)

SA.sources: Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)

VIC.sources: Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)

WA.sources: Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions V£.0 (2024)
EPD International Product Category Rules PCR2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, Volume 180, 2017
